comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content:
EA-6A Intruder Bu No 156979
Delivered December 18 1968 -Combat loss April 1972 with US Marine Corps unit VMCJ-1

comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content:
EA-6A Intruder info

EA-6A production;
Only 28 EA-6As were built (two prototypes, 15 new-build, and 11 conversions from A-6As), serving with Marine Corps squadrons in Vietnam. It was phased out of front-line service in the mid-1970s, remaining in use in reserve units with the USMC and then the US Navy primarily for training purposes. The last had been retired completely by 1993.
Here's an EA-6A list:
147865 Static display CPNC was “prototype”
148616
148618 Static display Key West was “prototype”

Known losses/strikes:
April 1972 NVN Combat loss VMCJ-1 crew (Leet/Christiansen) not recovered
May 1972 CPNC-VMCJ-2? crew (Buchanan/Pitz) ejected recovered.
Dec 1972 PI VMCJ-1 crew (Hal Baker/Killebrew) ejected recovered-last war fixed wing loss?
Oct 1973 VMCJ-1? USS Midway (Eve/Moody) crew not recovered.
1977? CPNC VMAQ-2 (Brunell/?????) 149477 engine door came off?  No eject. Crew recovered
Feb 1991 Florida USN/VAQ-33 crew (Heid/Stanton) ejected recovered.
 
CVA-66 USS America. Spithead England UK 2nd October 1974.
Navy aircraft wore code AJ of CVW-8
